intro: Psychotria boivinii, commonly known as the Boivin's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It often grows in shaded, humid environments and is typically found in the understory of tropical forests. Psychotria boivinii is also noted for its chemical composition, which includes various alkaloids, though it is not as well-studied as other species in the genus.
